chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovan M Lozano

records.addlTxt: and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). $500.00 previously posted. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jennifer M. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Officer Leerek except only for legitimate emergencies. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 1700 block of Onsgard Rd in Madison. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17
DCPS referral

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Jovan M Lozano in court.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Jovan M Lozano.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Rob Csencsics from DCPS also in court. In court today for a bail/bond hearing as requested by the defense. State objects and gives argument. Mr. Csencsics gives statement. Atty Moyers gives argument. Court makes findings and will remove the GPS condition from bond conditions. All other bail conditions will remain the same.
Bail/bond hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:41 AM Defendant Jovan M Lozano in court, in custody, with attorney Guy Cardamone who appeared on behalf of atty Erin Nagy. Prosecuting Atty William Brown appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nagy has filed motion to withdraw due to conflict.  State takes no position.  Court grants motion to withdraw and finds good cause to continue hearing to allow additional time for reappointment of counsel.

The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.

- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.
